title: How to Change the Color of Your iPhone

steps.headline: Decide if you are worried about placing a sticker on your iPhone.
steps.description: A sticker will wear over time, peeling back and leaving sticky residue. But, if you want a low cost color change, this is the best way to do it.

steps.headline: Research companies that sell skins on the Internet.
steps.description: There are dozens, if not hundreds, of companies who provide sticker decals for your iPhone.

steps.headline: Order the skin of your choice.
steps.description: Skins can range from $5 to $50, depending upon the look and the quality.

steps.headline: Wash the iPhone in advance.
steps.description: Use a computer-safe spray and/or microfiber cloth. A clean surface will provide better adhesion.

steps.headline: Practice the placement of the decals before you peel off the back of the skin.
steps.description: Placing it on the right area the first time is the best way to ensure it will stay put for a long time.

steps.headline: Use a steady hand when applying the decals.
steps.description: Ask someone to do it for you, if you do not believe you can apply it well.

steps.headline: Decide if you want to swap the color of the case yourself.
steps.description: You can get do-it-yourself kits on the Internet that come with new displays and backs. Note that this is a mid-range cost option. It will also void the warranty on your iPhone.

steps.headline: Research iPhone color swap kits on the Internet.
steps.description: They range from approximately $50 to $100, and are available through numerous vendors.

steps.headline: Choose your color and order it.
Buy mini-screwdrivers, if you do not own one already.
steps.description: Different iPhone models require different screwdriver heads.

steps.headline: Read the instructions carefully when the kit arrives.
Clean a workspace, where you will install your new color panels.
Use your screwdriver to remove the screws at the bottom of the iPhone.
steps.description: Make sure you place them in a small cup so you don't lose them.

steps.headline: Push up on the bottom of the back.
steps.description: It should move a few centimeters up.

steps.headline: Lift the top portion off and remove your old back.
Replace the back and screw it into place with your original screws.
Decide if you want a professional company to change the color of your iPhone.
steps.description: This will involve voiding the warranty and sending your phone away for approximately 2 weeks. This is the most expensive option, short of buying a new iPhone in a different color when Apple offers more colors in the future. It will cost between $200 and $300, plus shipping.

steps.headline: Research companies that offer this service.
Choose a company that guarantees to send your iPhone back in working order.
steps.description: You can also buy a package that offers future repairs.

steps.headline: Buy your customization.
Backup your iPhone.
steps.description: Remove any passcodes. The company doing the customization will need full access to your phone. Consider the privacy implications of sending your phone away. If you keep sensitive information on your phone, this may not be the best option.

steps.headline: Wait 2 weeks to receive your iPhone with new color panels.

text: iPhone Skins Decide if you are worried about placing a sticker on your iPhone. A sticker will wear over time, peeling back and leaving sticky residue. But, if you want a low cost color change, this is the best way to do it. Research companies that sell skins on the Internet. There are dozens, if not hundreds, of companies who provide sticker decals for your iPhone. Order the skin of your choice. Skins can range from $5 to $50, depending upon the look and the quality. Wash the iPhone in advance. Use a computer-safe spray and/or microfiber cloth. A clean surface will provide better adhesion. Practice the placement of the decals before you peel off the back of the skin. Placing it on the right area the first time is the best way to ensure it will stay put for a long time. Use a steady hand when applying the decals. Ask someone to do it for you, if you do not believe you can apply it well. iPhone Back Replacement Decide if you want to swap the color of the case yourself. You can get do-it-yourself kits on the Internet that come with new displays and backs. Note that this is a mid-range cost option. It will also void the warranty on your iPhone. Research iPhone color swap kits on the Internet. They range from approximately $50 to $100, and are available through numerous vendors. Choose your color and order it.  Buy mini-screwdrivers, if you do not own one already. Different iPhone models require different screwdriver heads. Read the instructions carefully when the kit arrives.  Clean a workspace, where you will install your new color panels.  Use your screwdriver to remove the screws at the bottom of the iPhone. Make sure you place them in a small cup so you don't lose them. Push up on the bottom of the back. It should move a few centimeters up. Lift the top portion off and remove your old back.  Replace the back and screw it into place with your original screws.  iPhone Customization Decide if you want a professional company to change the color of your iPhone. This will involve voiding the warranty and sending your phone away for approximately 2 weeks. This is the most expensive option, short of buying a new iPhone in a different color when Apple offers more colors in the future. It will cost between $200 and $300, plus shipping. Research companies that offer this service.  Choose a company that guarantees to send your iPhone back in working order. You can also buy a package that offers future repairs. Buy your customization.  Backup your iPhone. Remove any passcodes. The company doing the customization will need full access to your phone. Consider the privacy implications of sending your phone away. If you keep sensitive information on your phone, this may not be the best option. Wait 2 weeks to receive your iPhone with new color panels.
sentences: iPhone Skins Decide if you are worried about placing a sticker on your iPhone.
A sticker will wear over time, peeling back and leaving sticky residue.
But, if you want a low cost color change, this is the best way to do it.
Research companies that sell skins on the Internet.
There are dozens, if not hundreds, of companies who provide sticker decals for your iPhone.
Order the skin of your choice.
Skins can range from $5 to $50, depending upon the look and the quality.
Wash the iPhone in advance.
Use a computer-safe spray and/or microfiber cloth.
A clean surface will provide better adhesion.
Practice the placement of the decals before you peel off the back of the skin.
Placing it on the right area the first time is the best way to ensure it will stay put for a long time.
Use a steady hand when applying the decals.
Ask someone to do it for you, if you do not believe you can apply it well.
iPhone Back Replacement Decide if you want to swap the color of the case yourself.
You can get do-it-yourself kits on the Internet that come with new displays and backs.
Note that this is a mid-range cost option.
It will also void the warranty on your iPhone.
Research iPhone color swap kits on the Internet.
They range from approximately $50 to $100, and are available through numerous vendors.
Choose your color and order it.
Buy mini-screwdrivers, if you do not own one already.
Different iPhone models require different screwdriver heads.
Read the instructions carefully when the kit arrives.
Clean a workspace, where you will install your new color panels.
Use your screwdriver to remove the screws at the bottom of the iPhone.
Make sure you place them in a small cup so you don't lose them.
Push up on the bottom of the back.
It should move a few centimeters up.
Lift the top portion off and remove your old back.
Replace the back and screw it into place with your original screws.
iPhone Customization Decide if you want a professional company to change the color of your iPhone.
This will involve voiding the warranty and sending your phone away for approximately 2 weeks.
This is the most expensive option, short of buying a new iPhone in a different color when Apple offers more colors in the future.
It will cost between $200 and $300, plus shipping.
Research companies that offer this service.
Choose a company that guarantees to send your iPhone back in working order.
You can also buy a package that offers future repairs.
Buy your customization.
Backup your iPhone.
Remove any passcodes.
The company doing the customization will need full access to your phone.
Consider the privacy implications of sending your phone away.
If you keep sensitive information on your phone, this may not be the best option.
Wait 2 weeks to receive your iPhone with new color panels.
